H0.text: A pie chart is the type of graph best for recording plant growth over a one-week period.

H1.text: Line graph is the best type of graph for recording plant growth over a one‑week period.

H2.text: Scatterplot is the best type of graph for recording plant growth over a one‑week period.

H3.text: Histogram is the type of graph that would be best for recording plant growth over a one-week period.

A4.text: If we now perform the same type of random walk on the vertices of the line graph, the frequency with which v is visited can be completely different from f.

A5.text: In a line graph L(G), each vertex of degree k in the original graph G creates k(k − 1)/2 edges in the line graph. For many types of analysis this means high‑degree nodes in G are over‑represented in the line graph L(G).

A6.text: A line chart may be used to demonstrate the trend over time.

A7.text: dot plots and bar charts outperform pie charts

A8.text: Growth curve (statistics), an empirical model of the evolution of a quantity over time.

A9.text: Growth curve (biology), a statistical growth curve used to model a biological quantity.
